title: Fleuve
description:
_French: a river_

- Create flows by connecting cards.

## Try it out!

- Press ➡️ ➡️ to activate the next card.

_When you’re ready, delete this card and create a new flow below._

title: Another card
description:
## Nice!

- Press ⬇️ to select the card below.
- Press Space, Enter, or ➡️ to activate it.

title: A sibling card
description:
## Well done!

Now activate the cards below to learn about editing card titles and descriptions.

title: Edit title
description:
## Editing cards

- Press Tab to focus the title and edit it. 
- Press Enter or Escape when done.

_Try editing the description of the next card._

title: Delete cards
description:
## Delete me! It’s okay, I don’t mind.

- Press backspace or delete to remove a card.
- You’ll be asked to confirm before the card is removed.

title: Infinite levels
description:
## Drill, drill drill

- Press ➡️ to drill down through the hierarchy.
- Press ⬅️ to drill back up.

title: Reorder cards
description:
## Up is up, down is down

- Press Shift ⬆️ to move a card up.
- Press Shift ⬇️ to move it down.

title: Change levels
description:
## Left is left, right is right

- Press Shift ⬅️ to move a card left.
- Press Shift ➡️ to move a card right. It will be connected to the nearest card.

title: Rearrange me
description:
1. Move me up.
2. Move me down.
3. Move me right.
4. Move me left.

title: Add a level
description:
- Press Option/Alt ➡️ to move a card to the right.
- The card will be connected to a new untitled card.
- Press Option/Alt ⬅️ to move a card left, replacing its parent. This only works if the parent card is empty.

title: Edit description
description:
- Press D or E to edit the description.
- You can also double-click to edit, or click the pencil button.
- Press Enter or Tab when done.

_Use markdown to format descriptions._

title: Add more cards
description:
- Press the right arrow to connect a card to this one.
- Press the down arrow to add a card at the same level as this one.

_You’re on your own!_

title: Markdown styles
description:
Some example styles in Markdown. Double-click to see the raw formatting.

# Header 1
For the important stuff.

## Header 2
Slightly less important.

### Header 3
Bold sans, same size as regular text.

#### Header 4
Sans, same size as regular text.

##### Header 5
Small caps bold.

###### Header 6
Small caps regular.

## Bulleted lists
- Dash space makes a list item.
- Add multiple items
- Here's another item
  - With a nested list
  - Ooh, neat!

## Ordered lists
1. Numbered items get numbered
2. This is the second item.
3. And this is the third.
